title: Join our webinar “Understanding the impact of CBAM on your business” - essenscia
author: Emilie Hanchar
source: Essenscia - Belgian Federation For Chemistry And Life Sciences Industries
text: essenscia and KPMG invite you to join a webinar on December 1st at 11am on the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) and its impact on your business during the ongoing transitional phase. As of 1 October 2023, importers of CBAM goods into the EU are subject to new reporting requirements regarding the carbon content of the goods, the identity and location of the installations where the goods were produced, any carbon price already paid, etc. The report for the first reporting period must be submitted no later than 31 January 2024.
